result.execSummary:
The defendant Dyresha Shavonda Lawrence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 1 day time served.
If the defendant pays restitution and commits no new violations, Court will allow probation to be terminated after 6 months.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $853.00 to Latoya B. or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived; all mandatory costs and surcharges are to be paid during the term of probation. Defendant to submit DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dyresha Shavonda Lawrence

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dyresha Shavonda Lawrence in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Statements made by Latoya B.  Court reiterated the no contact order.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (06/11/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-17-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Latoya B. or the residence or place of employment

Defendant Dyresha Shavonda Lawrence in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/10/15 @ 1:30 pm
